nodes.name: Code - Rebuild Blog Blocks with Image References

parameters.content:
## 1. **Content Retrieval** (3 nodes)
   - Notion: Get content marked "Approved"
   - Extract folder details and session ID
   - Google Drive: List all files in session folder
## => Download all the Social Drafts & Image TaskList

## => Download image binary & storing
## 5. **Decision Engine** (1 node)
   - Detect needed vs. available images
   - Execute hierarchy logic
## 6. **Image Download & Processing** (2 nodes)
   - Prepare downloads list
   - Batch download images
## 7. **Arrange all the Drafts & the images if any in proper format**

## 8. **Blog Publishing Branch** (7 nodes)
   - Format for Sanity CMS structure
   - API publishing with metadata
   














   - Extract blog URL
   - Image embedding with alt text

## 9. **LinkedIn Publishing Branch** (5 nodes with Error Handling)
   - Format for LinkedIn
   - OAuth2 authenticated posting



   - Extract post URL
   - Timeout/rate limit recovery

## 10. **Twitter Branch Publishing** (12 nodes with Error Handling)












   - Format Twitter thread (4 tweets max)
   - OAuth2 authenticated posting
   - Extract tweet IDs
   - Build thread structure
   - Exponential backoff retry logic

## 2. **Asset Organization** (2 nodes)
   - Code: Organize Assets   
- Code: Prepare image download queue

## 11. **Status Tracking & Completion** (2 nodes)
   - Update Notion with all platform links
   - Set status to "Posted"
   - Log execution metadata

main.node: Code - Rebuild Blog Blocks with Image References

IF - Image Exists?.text: The N x M integration problem is a nightmare. Connecting 10 AI clients to 20 tools used to mean 200 custom builds. I've started using the Model Context Protocol (MCP), which is like a USB-C for AI. It turns N*M integrations into a manageable N+M. A huge time saver.

IF - Is This First Tweet?.text: The N x M integration problem is a nightmare. Connecting 10 AI clients to 20 tools used to mean 200 custom builds. I've started using the Model Context Protocol (MCP), which is like a USB-C for AI. It turns N*M integrations into a manageable N+M. A huge time saver.
